fields.summary: Issues Search Results - Freeze Panes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25559].
  {panel}

I want to change the information on our Jira application when a user can´t access the account and then click the Can't access your account? link to look as your implementation shown below:

Information on page https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ForgotLoginDetails.jspa

If you can't access JIRA, fill in this form and an email will be sent to you with the details to access your account again.

When entering the username and a user does not exist I receive this message "A reset password link has been sent to you via email. You can follow that link and select a new password. If the email does not arrive, please contact your JIRA administrators."

How do I configure my Jira application to generate the above message instead of the default "No user with that username exists."

Please get back to me as soon as possible.

Best Regards,
Joakim Gahm
fields.summary: Can't access your account?

fields.description:
In JIRA 4.2, we changed how timetracking works with regards to being able to edit Original and Remaining Estimates separately.

JIRA's {{IssueService}} provides an API to assist in updating an issue's fields - {{IssueInputParameters}}. This API was not updated when the timetracking changes were made. Thus, with the current version of this interface, it is not easy to make those issue field updates (some overriding is required).

It'd be helpful for plugin developers/consumers of this API if it was brought up-to-date. I've already done this within GreenHopper - we just need to push the changes back into JIRA.
fields.summary: IssueInputParameters API is not compatible with the timetracking changes made in JIRA 4.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25557].
  {panel}

This will mean avatars/icons display in mail clients where in situations that they can't resolve the img hrefs

* when external image loading is disabled for security
* when the href points to somewhere (DMZ) that the mail client can't see
* when the mail client is considered the anon user by the jira serving the image (they get the bog-standard avatar, not the customized avatar)
fields.summary: Use mime attachements to embed avatars and other icons into html emails

fields.description:
According to the release note below, JIRA 4.4 allows you to attach multiple files in JIRA.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.4+Release+Notes
Safari (running on Mac OS) this does not seem to have this feature. I've also tested IE8 on MSWS-2003 and this also does not seem to work.
fields.summary: Attachment of multiple files works only for particular browsers

fields.description:
When creating a new user, the new account is added to all groups with the jira-use permission.  When there are nested groups this included any child groups of a group with that permission.  This has 2 undesirable effects:
* The user is added to groups that may give the user unintended permissions
* The user is added redundantly to many child groups unnecessarily.
fields.summary: When creating a new user, new account is added to all nested group of jira-users

fields.description:
I (like many people) use extensively the 'jira suite utilities' plugin, especially for 'field required' validator in transitions.
Unfortunately, the labels of these fields are not displayed with a red asterisk to mention there are required; and the user only gets a warning when he tries to validate the transition.

JIRA should display an asterisk when fields are required in a transition...
fields.summary: Display of Red Asterisk on field label when field required validator is used
Add .equals method to ProjectCategory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25550].
  {panel}

JIRA currently have the following [Permission Setting|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory#ConnectingtoanLDAPDirectory-PermissionSettings]:
* Read Only 
* Read Only, with Local Groups 
* Read/Write 

JIRA should also add a permission that not only allow JIRA to read the user from LDAP but allow user to reset their password in LDAP via JIRA UI.
fields.summary: Separate Permission For Resetting Password For JIRA Integrated With LDAP

fields.description:
When you open the Edit project link in a new tab, the Project Avatar picker doesn't work.

* Go to the Administration section.
* Select a project to go to the project administration page.
* Select the summary tab on the Left.
* Right click on the Edit Project link (upper right) en open the link in a new tab.
* Click the Project Avatar.

At the bottom of the page i get the following:

{quote}
Custom

Oops! A server error has occurred. Please check that you are logged in and have sufficient permissions. (Retry 0 of 4)

This error is persistent. Please contact your server administrator for more information.
{quote}

It doesn't matter if you're a JIRA-Administrator, JIRA-System-Administrator or Project administrator.
fields.summary: Project Avatar Picker Doesn't work in new tab.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25548].
  {panel}

The new Workflow Viewer does not show the transitions as they are drawn in Workflow Designer.

1. Edit an existing workflow in Workflow Designer using different styles of transition lines.
2. Open an issue that uses the edited workflow.
3. Click on 'View Workflow' in status field.
--> Line styles (straight, polygonal, bezier) do not match.
fields.summary: Workflow Viewer should show the transition lines as they are drawn using the Workflow Designer

# Log in as a user without admin permission.
# manually hit any of the user directory pages e.g.

* http://localhost:8090/jira/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/list
* http://localhost:8090/jira/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/edit?directoryId=1

* login?dest-url=/secure/admin/XmlBackup!default.jspa&permission-vilation=true
* /secure/admin/XmlBackup!default.jspa

fields.description:
# Create two issues: one with a summary of "before:after" and another called "before:"
# Run a JQL search {{summary ~ before:after}}. It will match the one issue.
# *[BUG]* Run a JQL search {{summary ~ before:}}. You will get a parse error "Unable to parse the text 'before:' for field 'summary'." It should actually be returning the second issue you just created.

You may be able to work around this problem by performing some extra escaping. For example, the query:

{noformat}
summary ~ "before\\:"
{noformat}

will probably work for you.
fields.summary: JIRA allows the searching of ":" in the middle but not at the end of a text string.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25522].
  {panel}

According to jira documentation:

The "NOT IN" operator will not match a field that has no value (i.e. a field that is empty). For example, assignee not in (jack,jill) will only match issues that have an assignee and the assignee is not "jack" or "jill". To find issues that are assigned to someone other than "jack" or "jill" or are unassigned, you would need to type: assignee not in (jack,jill) or assignee is empty.


This is very frustrating, and besides that our users are not aware of this limitation (unless they dig in the doc which they never do) and thus complain that the query results are not correct.
I would also believe that a 'not in' result should return non-match AND empty values.
fields.summary: Allow 'NOT IN' operator to return empty values in JQL queries

fields.description:
The {{UpgradeTask_Build552}} class upgrades gadget configurations only if you have named your old pre-Jira 4.3 labels custom field as "Labels".

h6. To Reproduce
# Install the *Labels Plugin* version 2.4.1 into Jira 4.1.2
# Add only 1 *Labels Custom Field* to your Jira and call it something _other than Labels_, like say *Tags*
# Add the *Labels* gadget to a dashboard, say the System Default dashboard
# Upgrade to Jira 4.3.4
# Go to the System Default dashboard

h6. Expected Result
*Labels* gadget is there (now a jira-gadgets bundled plugin gadget rather than a Labels Plugin gadget)

h6. Actual Result
{noformat}Error loading gadget from rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.labels:labels-gadget/templates/plugins/labels/gadget/labels-gadget.xml: org.apache.shindig.gadgets.GadgetException: Unable to retrieve gadget xml. HTTP error 404{noformat}
!no labels gadget.png!

fields.description:
See vid for visual/ audio description. 

Steps to reproduce: 
(1) Create a few issue types where at least two of them have a sub-task status
(2) Create an issue that has an associated sub-task issue
(3) Select to convert the sub-task issue into another issue type
(4) The sub-task issue types do not appear as options for conversion

Note that the screenshot I am sharing shows the two sub-task issue types when I click on the yellow Help icon. If they are not intended as options for conversion, this is confusing.
fields.summary: I cannot convert an Issue type that has a sub-task status to another issue type that has a sub-task status, but would expect to be able to do so

fields.description:
See the attached vid for a visual/ audio description.

To reproduce:
(1) Create a multi-select field with several options, one of which is "none." Note that it wasn't apparent that "None" was already an option in the multi-select fields. 
(2) Assign "None" as the default value
(3) Assign the custom field to an issue
(4) Create an issue with the custom field
(5) View that two "nones" are now present in the issue
(6) Return to configure the custom field, and change the default from "None" to another option
(7) Delete None as an option
(8) Return to configure the default and note that you do not have the option of defaulting to "None"
fields.summary: "None" is not a selectable default option for a multi-select custom field, and as it is not, it both causes confusion in the field creation process as well as gets the user "stuck" on another default option

fields.description:
The {{/project}} API method, according to the [documentation|http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id2476168]:
bq. Returns a list of projects for which the user has the BROWSE project permission.

This is not true. The projects returned also include those which the user has {{ADMINISTER}} and {{PROJECT_ADMIN}} permissions for. Thus, if you are consuming this method to get a list of projects which the user can browse the issues of, you can get incorrect results.

The documentation should be fixed to reflect the actual results. In addition, it would be great if there did exist _another_ method which did in fact only return issues to which the current user has {{BROWSE}} permission for.
fields.summary: API documentation for /project method is incorrect

Hello guys,

Currently there is no way to edit some fields via email. You can only create issues (and set some fields during the creation), or add comments in the ticket. However, you cannot, for instance, set the assignee of a particular issue from email.

Are there any chance that this could get implemented in future releases?

Cheers
Thiago Prisco

fields.description:
The Javadocs for the JIRA source is a significant resource for plugin developers. As more source code gets move to packages outside com.atlassian.jira, those packages have to be added to the list of directories that Javadoc should use.

For instance
http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/4.3.4/com/atlassian/jira/portal/ProjectValuesGenerator.html#getValues(java.util.Map) 
has the information: "getValues in interface com.atlassian.configurable.ValuesGenerator"

The text "com.atlassian.configurable.ValuesGenerator" is a link to that interface in 4.2 but in 4.3 and later it is not.
Javadoc now allows you to build the documents in separate builds and have the links added in later builds.
fields.summary: Javadocs are not including all the Atlassian classes

2) Add Activity Stream Gadget for a project

fields.description:
Support receives significant number of request for assistance from customers regarding failed upgrade to JIRA 4.3+.

Currently implemented logic of the upgrade task does not take into account the external password management flag. We should consider checking on this attribute and fail the upgrade if {{osuser.xml}} isn't found.

A meaningful error should be produced in UI and the log file asking users to supply {{osuser.xml}} in order to continue with the upgrade.

Since JIRA 4.4 release (last 2w) Support has 12 issues for it that took 260h to be resolved.
fields.summary: failed upgrade to new user management due to missing osuser.xml

fields.description:
On initial JIRA 4.4 setup, if you import a JIRA data file that contains an expired licence, the admin gets stuck with no way to fix the licence.

1) Start up a brand new JIRA 4.4 instance.
2) Import an XML file with an expired lience.
3) The import is completed but the instance shows a Johnson screen:
!JIRALicenceError.png!

There is no way provided to fix the licence and continue with using the instance. The only workaround is to delete the database and start again from scratch.

In previous versions of JIRA, this error message linked to a page where you could update the licence.
fields.summary: Importing a file with an expired licence during Setup leaves the instance non-working with no way to fix the licence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25493].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when [Exporting Search Results to Excel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Exporting+Search+Results+to+Microsoft+Excel], the user interface by default only allows a user to export a maximum of 1000 issues to an excel spreadsheet.

h3. Suggested Solution
For JIRA Server - allow admins to increase the limit
For JIRA Cloud - Consider slightly increasing the limit, provided the Cloud Server can handle the increase
 
h3. Workaround 

*For Behind the Firewall Customers*

Please consult the KB article at [Export More than 1000 Results to Excel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Export+More+Than+1000+Results+to+Excel]

*For Cloud Customers*
Please consult the KB article at [Cloud - Export More than 1000 issues to Excel from Issue Navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Export+More+than+1000+Issues+to+Excel+from+Issue+Navigator+in+JIRA+Cloud]
fields.summary: Export to Excel is limited to a maximum of 1000 issues

fields.description:
We ship with two XSLT libraries: xalan and saxon. The way that {{[TransformerFactory|http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/javax/xml/transform/TransformerFactory.html]}} finds an implementation (as we ship now) is too look for {{META-INF/services/javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory}} on the classpath and then use the class listed therein (ala {{[ServiceLoader|http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/ServiceLoader.html]}}). The problem is that both xalan and saxon ship with a {{META-INF/services/javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory}} file which means that the library chosen to implement {{TransformerFactory}} depends on which of the two files the classloader decides to return first. 

This basically means that the XSLT library used in JIRA is completely dependent on the classloader which in turn is probably dependent on the order that jar files are listed in the file system. This is not a good situation to be in.
fields.summary: The XSLT library used by JIRA depends upon the order that xalan and saxon are loaded by the ClassLoader

fields.description:
The "Progress" column on Gadgets such as "Issues in progress" is not rendering properly.

To test:
# On a dashboard create an "Issues In Progress" gadget, edit it and add the "Progress" column
# Create 2 issues eg: "YOLO-1" and "YOLO-2"
# In YOLO-1 give the issue an Original Estimate of 1d and log work of 3h
# In YOLO-2 give the issue an Original Estimate of 5d only 
# Go back to the board and have a look at the bars
## Note on YOLO-1 only the Progress bar renders and not the Original Estimate bar
## Note on YOLO-2 neither bar renders 

In the issue navigator the progress bar does show up properly, but when on the Dashboard, Gadgets, "Issues in progress" and "assigned to me" they are not rendered correctly. 

Also some differences can be seen between Chrome and FF/IE in the gadget progress bar.
fields.summary: Progress bar does not display properly in Gadgets

fields.description:
The method getIssuesFromTextSearchWithProject of the XML RPC service and the soap service used to allow empty search terms. If the method is called with an empty search term it constructs a JQL query which contains the condition: text ~ "". The empty string is not supported for the text clause.

This is causing problems with clients expecting to be able to provide no/empty search terms.

The SearchService of the rpc plugin should not add the condition if no search terms are provided.
fields.summary: XML RPC API method getIssuesFromTextSearchWithProject does not allow empty search terms

fields.description:
I installed a custom field plugin to our Jira 4.4 server using the in-app uploader.  I then added that custom field to all issue types.  I then did an export, and tried to do a project import into a dev server where I'd installed the plugin manually.  The dev server cave an interesting message that the data had a custom field installed but that the plugin for that field had not been installed. (See screenshot, which also showed errors from greenhopper)

I checked the XML backup file, and there was no <PluginVersion> tag for the plugin I had upladed.  I restarted the server, did a new backup, and the new file had the <PluginVersion> tag correctly included.  Since this was a dev situation, there was not a big problem.  However, if I'd wanted to do a project import into production, I'd have had to tweak my xml backup file by hand to recover my data.

(I'm marking this as major because it can result in backup files which cannot be used for project import.)
fields.summary: PluginVersion tag missing from export xml

h3. Workaround

# Navigate to *Administration > Look And Field > Edit Configuration*.
# Save the current configuration (save it as a PDF).
# Reset the default *Logo* and *Favicon*.
# Reset all modified *​Colors​* and *​Gadget Colors​* by clicking on the *Revert* button for each modified color.
# This will repair the CSS - to verify this test the page that previously caused problems to verify it renders correctly.
# Add the logo's link again with Upload Logo and also add the Favicon if it was replaced.
# Set any customised colours back to what they were.
# Test to verify the instance is in the expected state and all is working.

For more information please refer to our [CSS Broken after Upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/CSS+Broken+after+Upgrade] KB article.

fields.description:
When logging in via REST, (as per http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+%28Alpha%29+Tutorial#JIRARESTAPI%28Alpha%29Tutorial-UserAuthentication ), clients call the http://hostname/rest/auth/ resource. They then take the JSESSIONID from the response body and use it for authentication on subsequent calls.

However, when authenticating to a JIRA instance that is using Crowd SSO (e.g. JIRA inside Studio), JESSSIONID is not enough - they also need to have the Crowd token in order to correctly authenticate. This means that a REST client tested against a normal JIRA instance will fail against SSO-enabled instances.

I think we should either modify the auth method to return SSO cookies as well, or remove the JSESSIONID from the body and force clients to pick up all cookies from the header.
fields.summary: REST auth method does not supply enough data to authenticate to SSO-connected instances

fields.description:
With respect to the following feature:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options#ConfiguringJIRAOptions-advanced

A customer added a comment to the following page, indicating that the {{jira.issue.actions.order}} property (now stored in the DB) has no effect at all.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+the+Default+Order+for+Comments+from+Ascending+to+Descending?focusedCommentId=254312459#comment-254312459

I've tried modifying this value through the Advanced Settings page too to find doing so has no effect either. However, I haven't yet tested modifying this in the {{jira-config.properties}} file, although the customer verified that this worked.

Could you please investigate this issue further? From what I can see, there are two solutions here:

* Fix the DB-stored property behaviour so that it works.
** From a customer's + tech writer perspective, this is the preferable option.
* Remove this option from the UI.
** I suspect this is the easier dev option, but doc rework is required.

Nevertheless, please advise on the solution you choose as it will affect the documentation.
fields.summary: Configuring the 'jira.issue.actions.order' property on JIRA's Advanced Settings page (AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa) has no effect.

  {panel}

I worked with a customer who was having issues following our documentation on Configuring Email Notifications specifically in regards to Configuring a Project's Email Address.

I was wondering if the following information could be added to the doc? Here is something along the lines of the information I want to add:

Please note that Gmail will override the outgoing email address unless it's an authorized address.  If you access Gmail through a POP or IMAP email client (e.g. Outlook) and would like to send messages with a custom "from" address, you have two options. We recommend that you configure your email client with two outgoing SMTP servers, one for Gmail and one for your other address. Or, you can use Gmail's outbound servers with a different "from" address. If you've already configured the alternate address, your message will be sent from:otheraddress@domain.com, sender:username@gmail.com, regardless of which custom from configuration you chose.

The custom 'From:' feature works only if you already own the account linker to the alternate address. To send mail with a different Gmail username, you must first sign up for that address.
fields.summary: Update Email Documentation

fields.description:
Hello Guys,

The problem is very easy to reproduce.

It is a known limitation that you cannot add JIRA Standalone as a service when using JAVA 64 Bits. However, you can install JIRA as a service using the Windows installer.

JIRA will work fine this way. However, even when using 64-bit JAVA, there is no way to increase the -Xmx value past the 32-bit limitation.

So, steps to reproduce:
- Install JIRA 4.3.x as a service
- Install jdk 64 bits (tested with 6.0_24, 6.0_27 and 7)
- JIRA should start fine. However, when trying to increase the heap memory (either via command line, or registry), the service keeps starting (it never reach the 'Started' or 'Failed' status). The only way to reset the service is manually killing it.

Is this a limitation with tomcat and Windows? 

Cheers
fields.summary: When JIRA is installed as a service, the memory cannot get past the 32-bit limitation, even when using 64-bit JAVA

fields.summary: Pluggable web panels are not really reloadable within JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25449].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

* Create a new workflow scheme
* Add all issue types to the given workflow scheme
* From the "Edit workflows page" reached from that workflows scheme, it is still possible to click "Assign a workflow to an issue type for this scheme.", which will show up with a non-existent issue type for assigning to workflows.
fields.summary: When all issue types are assigned to a workflow scheme, its still possible to enter the assign issue type to workflow scheme page
